metadata.title: Friday, 19th July, 2019
metadata.session: THIRD SESSION OF THE TWELFTH ASSEMBLY

parts: (a) what measures the Government is taking to curb the smuggling of maize and mealie meal from the Copperbelt towns into the Democratic Republic of Congo; and

questions.minister: Minister of Housing and Infrastructure Development
parts: (a) whether the Government has any plans to tar the Kalengwa-Kasempa-Kankolonkolo road;
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented;
(c) what the time frame for the completion of the project is; and
(d) what the total cost of the project is.

questions.minister: Minister of Lands and Natural Resources
parts: (a) how many Zambian truckers have been hired to transport the 3,400 containers of Mukula logs transiting through Zambia from the Democratic Republic of Congo to various ports in the region;
(b) if there are none, what measures are being taken to facilitate the participation of Zambian truckers in the business; and
(c) what the estimated revenue, in statutory fees, to be collected at the end of the exercise is.
(a) whether the Government has any plans to construct maternity wings and mothers’ shelters at all health centres in Mushindamo District;
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented; and
(c) what interim measures are being taken to ensure that expectant mothers do not give birth at their homes.
(a) what the total number of employees at the Engineering Services Corporation Limited (ESCO) was, as of March, 2019;
(b) what measures the Government is taking to ensure that ESCO’s revenue base does not decrease after the completion of the construction of Kazungula Bridge; and
(c) what other activities, besides operating pontoons, the Company is involved in.
(a) whether the Government is aware that the building materials for the construction of a health post at Kamazovu in Kashima East Ward in Mufumbwe District were redirected to Chavuma District; and
(b) if so, when the building materials will be replaced.
